intro: Laurembergia tetrandra subsp. brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stalked laurembergia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four stamens, which are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
